DOC.brief_summary: This single-dose , randomize , open-label , 2-sequence , 3-period study evaluate effect cyclosporine pharmacokinetics ritonavir-boosted danoprevir ( DNV/r ) healthy volunteer . Subjects randomize one two treatment sequence receive single oral dose DNV/r cyclosporine . In treatment period 3 , subject receive single oral dose DNV/r plus cyclosporine . Anticipated time study 33 day .
DOC.brief_title: A Drug-Drug Interaction Study Between Danoprevir/Low-Dose Ritonavir Cyclosporine Healthy Volunteers
DOC.criteria: Male female healthy volunteer , 18 45 year age inclusive Body mass index ( BMI ) 18.0 32.0 kg/m2 Weight > /= 50 kg Healthy status define absence evidence active chronic disease follow detailed medical surgical history complete physical examination Nonsmoker Females childbearing potential male female partner ( ) childbearing potential must agree use 2 form contraception , 1 must barrier method , study 90 day last drug administration ( acceptable barrier form condom diaphragm , acceptable nonbarrier form contraception study nonhormonal intrauterine device and/or spermicide ) Pregnant lactate female Positive result drug abuse urine screen prior admission clinical site study period Positive hepatitis B , hepatitis C HIV infection Current smoker subject discontinue smoke less 6 month prior first dose study medication Use hormonal contraceptive ( birth control pill , patch injectable , implantable device ) within 30 day first dose study medication Routine chronic use 2 g acetaminophen daily Use investigational drug device within 30 day screen ( 6 month biologic therapy ) 5 halflives investigational drug , whichever long History clinically significant disease disorder History clinically significant drugrelated allergy ( anaphylaxis ) hepatotoxicity History ( within 3 month screen ) alcohol consumption exceed 2 standard drink per day average ( 1 standard drink = 10 gram alcohol )
